main.name: Sourish Vaghulade
main.description: Machine Learning Enthusiast | Software Engineer | Optimist
main.bio: Hello, I'm a Second Year MS CS student at UMass Amherst. I'm passionate about tech, finance and all the nerdy things you can imagine! Few of my hobbies are gaming, reading and cooking. I'm actively looking for Full time opportunities in the role of an SDE/DS/MLE starting May 2021
main.contactmessage: Feel free to contact me for job opportunities or just to chat in general

education.description: Courses: Algorithms for Data Science, Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, Database Design & Implementation
Courses: Data Structures, Analysis of Algorithms, Java, Compiler Construction, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: Single-handedly designed and developed a scalable Full Stack SPA for internal analytics using React.js, Node.js, and Express.js. Automated tracking of Forge usage data for approximately 4000 repositories using AWS Lambda and saved 99.96% in cost revenue per month by shifting to serverless computing platform from AWS EC2. Established a CI/CD pipeline using Jenkins, Docker, and AWS for better code delivery and package updates.

work.title: Machine Learning Engineer Intern
work.description: Achieved 80% and 70% tracking accuracy in males and females through Object Detection & Classification methods by using Tensorflow, Keras and Caffe models. Generated data points such as total / unique men & women and individual view time for an advertisement for men and women per minute along with their age categories for a Tableau dashboard increasing annual revenue by $30K+. Automated the pipeline from fetching data on GCP to producing required data points using a python script. Generated data points such as user state (Attentive/Distracted) & emotion of the user(s) watching the content throughout the entire duration along with age & gender of the user(s).Developed a Django application to act as a front-end for the user(s) to watch the content provided & analyze the reactions (video & audio) in real-time.

work.title: Software Developer Intern
work.description: Co-developed an Android Application for an IoT device (Pillow) with features such as music player, calling, setting an alarm on the pillow and a light for reading at night. Debugged the client-side Python code along with modifying server-side SQL queries. Performed end-to-end testing on the whole project for seamless execution. Enabled Raspberry Pi to execute client scripts on startup automatically.

testimonials.text: "I have worked with Sourish on multiple projects over 3 years. Within this time frame, he has been a delight to work with. His leadership qualities and proactive attitude have helped getting any sort of work done. Sourish is always ready to go the extra mile, and takes on as many duties as he can, and glides through them with ease. For any topic that was new to us, he would study and research it and then come and explain it to everyone. All in all, Sourish is an excellent partner to work with, and an excellent friend."

"Sourish had an immediate impact working on a new project and was thoroughly involved from its inception till launch. His technical knowledge helped carry the project through various hurdles. He was also very receptive to feedback and also knew when to reach out to other engineers. He was collaborative, calm, and proactive throughout his time at athenahealth. Overall it was a pleasure to work with him and he would be a great asset to any engineering team."

"Sourish has worked with me as an intern for around 3 months and he is one of the brightest minds I had a chance to work with. His knowledge about computer vision algorithms is great for a fresher. His capability to take tasks to completion is commendable. His willingness to keep learning and developing AI tools and products for the society is worth appreciating. I wish him all the luck for his masters and future roles. I am sure he will turn out to the best of the lot. Cheers!"
